intro: Homalium damtongianum, commonly known as the Damtong mountain huito, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand and Myanmar. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
